title: Peri Brown
content:
She was an American college student who accidentally joined the Fifth Doctor during his visit to Lanzarote in 1984. She then elected to remain with him for the rest of her vacation time. She remained with the Doctor after his regeneration into his sixth incarnation. She found it harder to get along with him because of his recklessness, seeing him as arrogant and mad. However, as time went on, the Sixth Doctor's personality mellowed and Peri's friendship with him improved, especially after he returned to comfort her after the death of her mother.

Peri was separated from the Doctor by the Time Lords so that they could cover up the Ravolox conspiracy, with a Matrix record indicating that she had been brainwashed into becoming the Mentor leader Lord Kiv, before being killed. According to the Tremas Master, this record had been faked, and Peri had survived and had fallen in love with King Yrcanos, whom she married, subsequently making her Queen of Krontep. But that was just part of the truth. As it turned out, there were several future versions of Peri's life due to interventions of various Time Lord factions. At least two versions of Peri eventually rejoined the Sixth Doctor on his travels after Yrcanos died, one of whom choose to return to Krontep once a year to pay tribute to her late husband and check on the progress of the people she had once ruled.

Peri had limited contact with other companions, although she did encounter a few. She spent a significant amount of time alongside the uncrowned Egyptian Pharaoh Erimem, developing a deep sister-like bond. As well as this she had a series of adventures with Frobisher. She was also acquainted with Jamie McCrimmon, meeting him and the Second Doctor during an encounter with two Androgums and two leading members of the Ninth Sontaran Battle Group. She also briefly met Vislor Turlough who left the Doctor's company just prior to her joining, as well as Kamelion before his destruction. She also met Ace, accompanied by the Seventh Doctor, at the Factory, and became friends with Melanie Bush at LudoSphere Incorporated.

Perpugilliam Brown was born in 1966 as the only child of archaeologists (PROSE: Blue Box [+]Kate Orman, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2003).) Paul and Janine Brown, who had married on 21 November 1962. She had an aunt named Mona who lived on a trailer park. (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) "Perpugilliam" was an old family name (PROSE: Players [+]Terrance Dicks, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 1999).) which Peri claimed meant "she who lives in the hills" (AUDIO: The Bride of Peladon [+]Barnaby Edwards, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2008).) or "by a handful" (PROSE: A Handful of Stardust [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) and which she often found people had difficulty pronouncing. (PROSE: Revelation of the Daleks [+]Eric Saward, adapted from Revelation of the Daleks (Eric Saward), BBC Books novelisations (BBC Books, 2019).)

According to most accounts, Peri was raised in Baltimore, (PROSE: House [+]Jeremy Daw, Short Trips: Steel Skies (Short Trips, 2003)., The Ruins of Heaven [+]Marc Platt, Short Trips: Steel Skies (Short Trips, Big Finish Productions, 2003).; AUDIO: Nekromanteia [+]Austen Atkinson, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2003)., The Macros [+]Ingrid Pitt and Tony Rudlin, adapted from The Macro Men, The Lost Stories (Big Finish Productions, 2010).) specifically Fell's Point (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).; PROSE: When It Was Fun [+]James Goss and Steve Tribe, The Doctor: His Lives and Times (BBC Books, 2013).; TV: Vengeance on Varos [+]Phil Ford, Tales of the TARDIS (BBC iPlayer, 2023).) where she lived at 256 East Lombard Street. (PROSE: When It Was Fun [+]James Goss and Steve Tribe, The Doctor: His Lives and Times (BBC Books, 2013).) According to other accounts, she came from New York City, (PROSE: The Twin Dilemma [+]Eric Saward, adapted from The Twin Dilemma (Anthony Steven), Target novelisations (Target Books, 1986)., Revelation of the Daleks [+]Eric Saward, adapted from Revelation of the Daleks (Eric Saward), BBC Books novelisations (BBC Books, 2019).; AUDIO: The Authentic Experience [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) Pasadena (PROSE: Synthespians™ [+]Craig Hinton, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2004)., Something Borrowed [+]Richelle Mead, Puffin eshort (Puffin Books, 2013).) or New England, (PROSE: The Mark of the Rani [+]Pip and Jane Baker, adapted from The Mark of the Rani (Pip & Jane Baker), Target novelisations (Target Books, 1986).; AUDIO: ...ish [+]Phil Pascoe, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2002).) specifically Boston. (PROSE: The More Things Change [+]Andy Lane, Doctor Who Yearbooks (1993).)

Peri was raised as a Baptist (AUDIO: The Council of Nicaea [+]Caroline Symcox, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2005).) and made to attend church every week, (PROSE: The Ruins of Heaven [+]Marc Platt, Short Trips: Steel Skies (Short Trips, Big Finish Productions, 2003).) but she would later consider herself not to be religious. (AUDIO: The Council of Nicaea [+]Caroline Symcox, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2005).) She travelled the world with her parents due to their careers (PROSE: Blue Box [+]Kate Orman, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2003).) and went to Manhattan every Thanksgiving. (AUDIO: Paradise 5 [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) She enjoyed a comfortable life thanks to her parents' wealth, but she was only truly happy amongst nature and was fascinated with botany. (PROSE: Synthespians™ [+]Craig Hinton, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2004).) She was best friends with Kathy Chambers, whose brother Nate she fancied. (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).)

Janine once took Peri to the Boston Botanical Centre when she was eleven (PROSE: Superior Beings [+]Nick Walters, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2001).) and she once visited Kew Gardens and Wembley Stadium where she saw AC/DC and the Who, (PROSE: The Church of Football [+]Benjamin Adams, Short Trips: The Centenarian (Short Trips short stories, 2006).) although she would later tell the Sixth Doctor that she had never visited London. (TV: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Paula Moore, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).) She also visited Bath Abbey, (PROSE: Superior Beings [+]Nick Walters, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2001).) Las Vegas (PROSE: Something Borrowed [+]Richelle Mead, Puffin eshort (Puffin Books, 2013).), San Francisco (AUDIO: Prime Winner) and France, where she walked in the gardens of a chateau. (AUDIO: Breaking Bubbles [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

As a girl, Peri read the comic book Swamp Thing (PROSE: Players [+]Terrance Dicks, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 1999).) and read about the Philadelphia Experiment. (AUDIO: The Macros [+]Ingrid Pitt and Tony Rudlin, adapted from The Macro Men, The Lost Stories (Big Finish Productions, 2010).) Her father took her out hunting and they had a dog called Whiskey. (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) She had the opportunity to take horse-riding lessons, but chose not to (AUDIO: The Church and the Crown [+]Cavan Scott and Mark Wright, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2002).) and later remarked that she never had time. (AUDIO: Leviathan [+]Paul Finch, The Lost Stories (Big Finish Productions, 2010).) Whilst living in Baltimore, she would sometimes go to the graveyard and read inscriptions upon the tombstones. (AUDIO: Emissary of the Daleks [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Paul taught Peri how to use a gun, although she did not like handling them (PROSE: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Eric Saward, adapted from Attack of the Cybermen (Paula Moore), Publication Order (Target Books, 1989).) and was not confident in her ability to use them. (TV: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Paula Moore, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).) When she was thirteen, her father died in a boating accident. (PROSE: Synthespians™ [+]Craig Hinton, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2004).) Janine married Professor Howard Foster, another archaeologist, who already had two children. (PROSE: Shell Shock [+]Simon A. Forward, Telos Doctor Who novellas (Telos Publishing, 2003).) Peri believed that Janine married Howard too soon after Paul's death. (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) According to some accounts, Howard sexually abused Peri and made her keep it a secret from Janine. (PROSE: Synthespians™ [+]Craig Hinton, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2004)., Shell Shock [+]Simon A. Forward, Telos Doctor Who novellas (Telos Publishing, 2003).)

In high school, Peri was a straight A student (AUDIO: Trouble in Paradise [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) and popular amongst her peers whilst Kathy was her "geeky friend". (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) She studied Christopher Columbus, whose actions she was disgusted by, in great detail (AUDIO: Trouble in Paradise [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) and learnt British history, covering Henry VIII. (AUDIO: Recorded Time [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) She was top of her class in botany and dreamed about discovering a new plant species or having a flower named after her. (AUDIO: Paradise 5 [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

In addition to Kathy, Peri was friends with Eunice, Paula, (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) and Candy Tyler, whom she once pushed into the path of a boy to prevent him from asking her to prom. (AUDIO: The Veiled Leopard [+]Iain McLaughlin and Claire Bartlett, Big Finish DWM originals (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) Candy never forgave her. (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) Peri and some of her friends once drove across the plains of Arizona. She would later remember how clearly she was able to see the stars that night, a view which was not surpassed until her travels with the Sixth Doctor. (AUDIO: The Shadows of Serenity [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Peri's first boyfriend was George Stewart, whom she nicknamed "Curious George" and who crashed the car on their way to their first date because he was distracted by her legs. When she was sixteen, she was dumped by "a real creep" and was upset until her grandmother called her and told her to pull herself together. She started dating Davey Silverman, who never left her alone for the first three months of their relationship and was nervous when she once used the subway, something that she interpreted as him being overprotective. (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Peri and Nate both disliked their names, which they thought were stupid, and agreed that they would one day get them changed. Peri knew that Nate was attracted to her, something that Kathy was also aware of and found weird on account of her and Peri being best friends. (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) In her gap year, she read À la recherche du temps perdu and believed that Marcel Proust could have benefitted from a better editor. She also read Black Orchid (AUDIO: Year of the Pig [+]Matthew Sweet, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) and did a fair amount of serving drinks in cafés. (AUDIO: Paradise 5 [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Peri began studying Botany (TV: The Mysterious Planet [+]Robert Holmes, Doctor Who season 23 (BBC1, 1986).) at college (TV: Planet of Fire [+]Peter Grimwade, Doctor Who season 21 (BBC1, 1984).) in 1983 (AUDIO: The Mind's Eye [+]Colin Brake, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2007)., Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) whilst maintaining an interest in archaeology thanks to her parents and Howard. (PROSE: Blue Box [+]Kate Orman, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2003).) Accounts differed on whether she attended Boston University, (PROSE: Burning Heart [+]Dave Stone, Virgin Missing Adventures (Virgin Books, 1997).) Berkeley (PROSE: Synthespians™ [+]Craig Hinton, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2004).) or California State.

Peri considered breaking up with Davey rather than have a long-distance relationship whilst she was at college and he punched a door when he realised this was the case. She ultimately decided to stay with him, (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) although she did date Chuck for a time and found that he was unable to give simple answers to any question, always speaking in "jargonese". (PROSE: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Eric Saward, adapted from Attack of the Cybermen (Paula Moore), Publication Order (Target Books, 1989).) She would later remark that she had to deal with a number of "dumb jocks" in college. (PROSE: Superior Beings [+]Nick Walters, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2001).)

On campus, Peri was a sports star, enjoying playing tennis, hockey and lacrosse. (PROSE: The Two Doctors [+]Robert Holmes, adapted from The Two Doctors (Robert Holmes), Target novelisations (Target Books, 1985).) Whenever she passed the Zoology laboratory on campus, she was glad that she chose to study Botany instead as she did not know what was going on with the animals inside. (AUDIO: Year of the Pig [+]Matthew Sweet, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) She shared a residence with other girls, (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) was friends with Sara (PROSE: Burning Heart [+]Dave Stone, Virgin Missing Adventures (Virgin Books, 1997).) and knew a girl with an eating disorder who was referred to a counsellor. (AUDIO: Year of the Pig [+]Matthew Sweet, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).)

Peri had a young cousin named Pete who had just started learning how to walk (AUDIO: The Song of Megaptera [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) by the time she went on holiday to Lanzarote in 1984. (TV: Planet of Fire [+]Peter Grimwade, Doctor Who season 21 (BBC1, 1984).) She carried a photograph of Pete around with her and fondly remembered how he laughed when he burped and burped when he laughed. (AUDIO: The Song of Megaptera [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

In Lanzarote on 9 May 1984, Peri met two Englishmen (AUDIO: The Reaping [+]Joseph Lidster, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).) and decided to go with them to Morocco before returning to college in the autumn, cashing in her return ticket to New York. However, Howard stopped her from making it to the airport on time by stranding her on a boat. Peri later escaped the boat by stripping down to her Bikini and attempting to swim for shore.

Peri was saved by Vislor Turlough from drowning and was taken by him into the TARDIS where she met the Fifth Doctor and Kamelion, who assumed Howard's form and, later, the Tremas Masters. Kamelion seized control of the TARDIS and took Peri to Sarn where she met the real Master. Following his defeat and Turlough's return to Trion with his brother, Peri joined the Doctor on his travels with the intention of returning to finish her degree. (TV: Planet of Fire [+]Peter Grimwade, Doctor Who season 21 (BBC1, 1984).)

When the Doctor received a summons and materialised the TARDIS in 12th century England, he decided that it was not the right place for Peri's adventures in time and space begin and told her to wait inside whilst he answered the call. (PROSE: Five Card Draw [+]Todd Green, Short Trips: Zodiac (Short Trips, 2002).)

On N'Tia, Peri began to regret joining the Doctor but decided that she had made the right choice upon seeing the planet's beauty. (PROSE: Light at the End of the Tunnel [+]Mark Wright, Short Trips: Steel Skies (Short Trips, Big Finish Productions, 2003).)

To recover from her experiences with the N'Tians, the Doctor took her shopping in London where they watched Les Misérables. (PROSE: Black and White [+]John Binns, Short Trips: Farewells (Short Trips short stories, 2006).)

The Doctor took Peri to Astroville Seven in the 31st century to help her acclimatise to being amongst various species of aliens and, wanting to choose clothes for herself rather than be limited to what was in the TARDIS wardrobe, she went shopping. They became caught up in a quest for the legendary treasure of Rovan Cartovall. (PROSE: The Ultimate Treasure [+]Christopher Bulis, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 1997).)

On Earth, she watched Len Skeggs die after stealing the Eye of Gaar. (PROSE: Hot Ice [+]Christopher Bulis, More Short Trips (Short Trips short stories, 1999).)

On Mars in the 2000s, Peri and the Doctor encountered the Ice Warriors and met the crew of the Argosy. When the Argosy crash-landed, Peri went with Paul and Tanya Webster to Izdaal's tomb. (AUDIO: Red Dawn [+]Justin Richards, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2000).)

A week into her adventures, she once again met the Master, this time in 1880s California. (PROSE: A Town Called Eternity [+]Lance Parkin and Mark Clapham, Short Trips and Side Steps (Short Trips short stories, BBC Books, 2000).)

A week later, the Doctor took her to watch a football game and she encountered Edward Grainger (PROSE: The Church of Football [+]Benjamin Adams, Short Trips: The Centenarian (Short Trips short stories, 2006).) before going to 2099 Prague. (PROSE: Leap Second [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

She later met the Valethske and narrowly avoided becoming a meal. Despite understanding how she felt, the Doctor disapproved of the visceral hatred she developed for Veek's people. (PROSE: Superior Beings [+]Nick Walters, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2001).)

After travelling alone with the Doctor, they met Erimem, a princess of ancient Egypt, who joined them in the TARDIS. (AUDIO: The Eye of the Scorpion [+]Iain McLaughlin, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2001).)

The Doctor intended to drop Erimem off on the Braxiatel Collection so that she could have an education. Instead, they arrived in 17th century Paris. There, Peri was kidnapped by the Duke of Buckingham, who believed that she was Queen Anne (a look-alike of Peri). After this adventure, the Doctor invited Erimem to join them travelling in the TARDIS. (AUDIO: The Church and the Crown [+]Cavan Scott and Mark Wright, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2002).)

By this time, Peri had found one of Leela's skins in the TARDIS wardrobe and considered wearing it on one occasion. (AUDIO: No Place Like Home [+]Iain McLaughlin, Big Finish DWM originals (Big Finish Productions, 2003).)

Peri grew exceptionally close to Erimem and hoped her feelings for Erimem were like those she had for a sister. (PROSE: Blood and Hope [+]Iain McLaughlin, Telos Doctor Who novellas (Telos Publishing, 2004).) She helped teach Erimem to read English.

The three battled Jarra To in the Axis, (AUDIO: The Axis of Insanity [+]Simon Furman, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2004).) defeated the Great Old Ones in the Himalayas (AUDIO: The Roof of the World [+]Adrian Rigelsford, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2004).) and prevented the Khellians from preying on a vulnerable Earth colony. (AUDIO: Three's a Crowd [+]Colin Brake, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2005).)

The trio next visited Nicaea in 325 AD, where they found themselves in the middle of a religious conflict. (AUDIO: The Council of Nicaea [+]Caroline Symcox, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2005).)

Peri and Erimem were stranded in 15th century Earth when the TARDIS separated them from the Doctor, having to work as serving wenches. They were eventually reunited with the Doctor after coming into conflict with William Shakespeare. (AUDIO: The Kingmaker [+]Nev Fountain, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2006).)

As part of a scheme with his seventh incarnation, the Doctor left Peri and Erimem in Monte Carlo in 1966 to stop the theft of the Veiled Leopard at a party. They discovered the thief was Lillian Hawthorne and stopped her getting away, returning the jewel to its safe. (AUDIO: The Veiled Leopard [+]Iain McLaughlin and Claire Bartlett, Big Finish DWM originals (Big Finish Productions, 2006).)

Later, Peri and Erimen corrected a change to the timeline caused by the Doctor's former companion Tegan Jovanka. The three women proceeded to go out and get drunk afterwards. (PROSE: Graham Dilley Saves the World [+]Iain McLaughlin and Claire Bartlett, Short Trips: Past Tense (Short Trips, 2004).)

In a hallucination induced by the plants of YT45, Kyropite, she believed that she had a boyfriend with a stepson, Kyle. She had to deal with Kyle's unruly behaviour. She was eventually found being ingested by the plants. Inside the dream her stepson caught Meningitis, this corresponded to her health deteriorating in the real world. As it got worse she imagined her partner cheating on her and then she was run over by a car. Takol wanted her to die for his experiment. She didn't recognise the Doctor when he went into her dream. As her dream became a bad drama, the Doctor asked her to choose. As she awoke the plant removed itself from her. Both Erimem and the Doctor took her back to the TARDIS to escape. (AUDIO: The Mind's Eye [+]Colin Brake, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2007).)

The Doctor, Peri and Erimem visited Peladon after answering a distress call from the Ice Warrior prince and ambassador Zixlyr in the 41st century. King Pelleas proposed to Erimem, and she accepted, parting with Peri and the Doctor to stay to rule Peladon. The Doctor and Peri departed for the TARDIS, still in orbit around Peladon with the help of Alpha Centauri's ship. (AUDIO: The Bride of Peladon [+]Barnaby Edwards, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2008).)

Soon after Erimem's departure, Peri and the Doctor went to the planet Grallista Social for a spot of relaxation but found themselves in the midst of a viral decontamination effort by the Viyrans. She was infected with a virus which turned anyone she came into contact with. The Viyrans were getting her to remember each time this happened, first with the Doctor, then with Chris and finally Lawrence as a way to remove her memories as part of the cure. Her memory wouldn't be erased as easily so the Viyran wanted to kill her. She realised that her memory was returning as her memory was trying to work out what had happened and why it was happening. (AUDIO: Mission of the Viyrans [+]Nicholas Briggs, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2007).)

Peri and the Doctor went to the village of Sair during the Middle Ages, where a young man named Tablibik used a form of magic to make her fall in love with him. The Doctor swiftly broke his spell. (PROSE: Fascination [+]David J. Howe, Decalog (Virgin Decalogs, 1994).)

After Peri was badly injured, the Doctor took her to Karn where she was kidnapped by Morbius. However, she was able to trick him into putting her into an escape pod and escaped to Sylvana where she became a guerrilla leader against his regime. She eventually rejoined the Doctor after he became the general of an army of Draconians, Sontarans, Cybermen and Ice Warriors against Morbius. (PROSE: Warmonger [+]Terrance Dicks, BBC Past Doctor Adventures (BBC Books, 2002).)

Peri was intentionally separated from the Doctor on an unnamed world. During this separation, the Doctor travelled briefly with a tracer named Amy whom he helped find the Key to Time. Peri was reunited with the Doctor after his second attempt at finding the Key to Time concluded. (AUDIO: The Judgement of Isskar [+]Simon Guerrier, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2009)., The Chaos Pool [+]Peter Anghelides, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2009).)

The two met an Essex priest who was hiding alien bodies in his church crypt in 1953. (PROSE: The Canvey Angels [+]David Bailey, Short Trips: Companions (Short Trips, Big Finish Productions, 2003).)

Peri was, for a time, separated from the Doctor on a World War I battlefield in 1914. (PROSE: Never Seen Cairo [+]Darren Sellars, Short Trips: A Christmas Treasury (Short Trips short stories, 2004).)

The two met Alistair Gordon Lethbridge-Stewart before encountering the Arix. (PROSE: A Life in the Day [+]Xanna Eve Chown, Short Trips: A Day in the Life (Short Trips short stories, 2005).)

Peri helped the Doctor save a group of human colonists beset by the carnivorous Farakosh. (AUDIO: Exotron [+]Paul Sutton, Main Range (Big Finish, 2007).)

Peri pretended to be a waitress in an alien restaurant to figure out why three different gourmets wanted to kill the Doctor. (AUDIO: Urban Myths [+]Paul Sutton, Main Range (Big Finish Productions, 2007).)

Peri helped the Doctor stop the Valtor from invading Beadledom 3. (AUDIO: Rulebook [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Arriving in Los Angeles in 2009 to stop Zarl from selling Earth's water to his fellow Piscons, Peri met a future version of herself who, unbeknownst to her, only remembered her first adventure with the Doctor. She was disgusted by her future self when she apparently killed Zarl and Carburetor and greatly upset upon learning that her future self had lied about having children, which she wanted more than anything. She decided that she would stay with Davey Silverman when her travels came to an end and wondered about how her relationship with the Doctor, who decided to take her to Androzani Minor, would change given what he had seen her future self do. (AUDIO: Peri and the Piscon Paradox [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.)

Whilst exploring Androzani Minor, Peri and the Doctor contracted spectrox toxaemia and became caught in the conflict over spectrox between Androzani Major government forces and Sharaz Jek's insurgency. They were arrested by government forces and sentenced to execution, but they were abducted by Jek, who was attracted to Peri. They escaped with the aid of fellow prisoner Salateen, however the Doctor became separated from them. Salateen took her back to the soldiers, however she was abducted by Jek again. She began to die from the disease and the Doctor gave her the single dose of bat's milk he was able to acquire before regenerating into a new incarnation, to her astonishment. (TV: The Caves of Androzani [+]Robert Holmes, Doctor Who season 21 (BBC1, 1984).)

Peri was disturbed by the Sixth Doctor's behaviour following his regeneration and terrified after he attempted to strangle her, leading him to decide to repent for his actions as a hermit on Titan III before they found the wounded Hugo Lang and learnt of the kidnapping of Romulus and Remus Sylvest. Joined by Hugo, they followed Azmael and the Sylvests to Jaconda where they were captured by Mestor, whom the Doctor and Azmael killed. Peri tried to get the Doctor to stay to help the Jacondans and admonished him for being rude to Hugo when they parted, but he asked her to get to wait before condemning his new persona. (TV: The Twin Dilemma [+]Anthony Steven, Doctor Who season 21 (BBC1, 1984).)

Peri wanted to return home, but decided to acquiesce to the Doctor's request and get to know him. (PROSE: The Twin Dilemma [+]Eric Saward, adapted from The Twin Dilemma (Anthony Steven), Target novelisations (Target Books, 1986).) He called Peri by the names of various former companions of his, as well as Zodin, in the days following Jaconda (TV: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Paula Moore, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).) and, according to one account, they spent a week frozen inside of a glacier on Vespod Eight. Otherwise, Peri spent her time studying in case she returned to college and demanded that she and the Doctor discuss terms for her remaining on the TARDIS. (PROSE: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Eric Saward, adapted from Attack of the Cybermen (Paula Moore), Publication Order (Target Books, 1989).)

After picking up Gustave Lytton's distress call in 1985, Peri and the Doctor descended into London's sewers and encountered Cybermen who infiltrated the TARDIS and forced the Doctor to take them, Lytton and Charles Griffiths to Telos. There, Peri was saved from a deranged Cyberman by Rost and Varne, from whom she learnt of the Cybermen's plan to destroy Earth and who wanted her to destroy the TARDIS to prevent this, and was eventually reunited with the Doctor. She told the Doctor that Lytton was working with the Cryons, but they were too late to save him and they left Telos before Cyber-Control was destroyed. (TV: Attack of the Cybermen [+]Paula Moore, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).)

The Doctor kept making attempts to repair the TARDIS's chameleon circuit, causing it to switch between various shapes before returning to the form of a police box. It was then that Peri demanded that he stop. (COMIC: Quick Change [+]Error: Code 2 - no data stored in variables, cache or SMW.) He had a number of accidents in the TARDIS, including burning dinner despite promising a cold supper, (TV: Vengeance on Varos [+]Philip Martin, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).) and Peri thought more and more about returning to college. (PROSE: Vengeance on Varos [+]Philip Martin, adapted from Vengeance on Varos (Philip Martin), Target novelisations (Target Books, 1988).)

When the TARDIS's trans-power system failed, Peri and the Doctor travelled to 23rd century Varos on emergency power to acquire Zeiton-7 and saved Jondar from execution in the Punishment Dome, only for Peri to be captured and taken to the Governor, the Chief Officer and Sil. She was accused of being a spy for Amorb and taken by Quillam for his cell mutation experiments, which began turning her into a bird hybrid, but the Doctor saved her and, after being recaptured and escaping with the Governor and Maldak, Sil was defeated. With a supply of Zeiton-7, Peri and the Doctor left to continue their travels. (TV: Vengeance on Varos [+]Philip Martin, Doctor Who season 22 (BBC1, 1985).)

Peri stayed in her bedroom reading Jeffrey Archer after leaving Varos because she was tired of being shouted at, but the Doctor barged in after detecting something following them through the Time Vortex.
